TopicTitle: The 0.25 Waiting Room, now boarding passengers heading to Hypetown

Articles.Content: just a side note i wanted to add, i do wish they would add a big more detail to the buildings if possible, the parking lot for the admin building and the pool just look off, though that isn't the current model so hopefully they look better now.

im a little disappointed to be honest, damageable buildings are only relevant for like the 5 seconds of a mission, basically nothing changes during the majority of gameplay.

Well you can do challenges (Starting career mode with a damaged KSC using Whack A Kerbal).

That was not worth the hype... That was stupid.

They said it's nothing big.
I feel sorry for the devs. All the work they put in is being harshly critised. They gave us the option to turn it on and off so now every one can be happy, right?

That was not worth the hype... That was stupid.

Remember it is the frame work so to say for a larger feature in 0.26. I think that it will be customizable space centers. Such as the Island Runway and KSC 2.
To all who's expectations were not met: It will be expanded on in 0.26.

Remember it is the frame work so to say for a larger feature in 0.26. I think that it will be customizable space centers. Such as the Island Runway and KSC 2.

This is what I was thinking.

http://www.twitch.tv/ksptv/b/572412425

At 48-49 minutes in.
Expect hype plane support to drastically fall as news of a destructible runway gets out.

http://imgur.com/a/TQQFf

Here comes the boom!

I like new particle effects finally something that looks like an intence, firey, explosion.
I did say it was a small silly thing! I adore it though.

Expect hype plane support to drastically fall as news of a destructible runway gets out.

Nah, it will only rise!

I feel sorry for the devs. All the work they put in is being harshly critised. They gave us the option to turn it on and off so now every one can be happy, right?

not sure why they were so secretive to begin with

im thinking Kerbal citys.

oh god the horror

I feel sorry for the devs. All the work they put in is being harshly critised. They gave us the option to turn it on and off so now every one can be happy, right?

It's more for performance than anything else. I'm not a big fan of it, but it it's added into the game then sure - why not? I see no reason to turn it off if your PC can handle it. And my should be able to as long as I don't have any Klaws.... *eyerolls*
I kind of like the destructible buildings, the way they do it is a little cheesy, but not in a bad way.

http://www.kerbalcomics.com/2013/01/02/episode-18-planet-of-the-kerbals/

Captain Skunky knew about this feature for almost a year! Or More!
Who guessed first?

not sure why they were so secretive to begin with

Keeping the element of surprise and also making sure that everything was exploding in the way we'd expected.
It'll be just like the good ol' days on SimCity 4, unleashing tornadoes, earthquakes, UFO's and killer robots on an unsuspecting kerpulation.

Who guessed first?

apparently im the only one who cares and it didnt look good that i asked more than once.
I thought the imploding VAB looked pretty cool.

still it's only relevant if you play career mode, pretty much nothing changes if you're a sandbox guy like myself. building a mun/minmus lander using only low-tech parts so you can unlock the higher tier stuff is only fun like the first dozen times you do it, after that its boring as hell.

http://www.kerbalcomics.com/2013/01/02/episode-18-planet-of-the-kerbals/

Captain Skunky knew about this feature for almost a year! Or More!

I miss that comic, and Skunky, too...

im a little disappointed to be honest, damageable buildings are only relevant for like the 5 seconds of a mission, basically nothing changes during the majority of gameplay.

I have not been to space or far from the KSC in months, so that depends a bit.
